Reviews.Title: Nice alternative to the crowd
Reviews.Author: Andrew Bishop
Reviews.Content: I recently also purchased a C5502 (Sony ZR) - which I am liking a lot. My daughter managed to kill another phone by dropping it (I'm beginning to think she does it on purpose!) 6 months into her contract.She liked my new phone, so I bought her this one - it's cheaper than the ZR, & don't want the expense if she drops it again.Just arrived 24 hours ago, and she's a happy girl again. - Facebook loads very quickly.Battery compartment a little awkward to get on an off.Battery life should be pretty good - I found something called stamina mode in the settings on mine, that cuts non essential processing and info flow when the screen is off. - really saves on the juice. - You can white-list any apps you want to continue receiving data.It also has NFC (near field communication) that normally only comes with higher end phones (Though, I personally, have yet to use it for anything)Camera- 8MP - CMOS sensor and HDR. reasonable in low light - Takes some very good photos (for a phone)Definite bonus - Micro SD slot to expand memory.Screen nice and bright - good picture -  224ppi - not as sharp as some, but more than adequate for browsing the web, - Certainly as good as phones in the same price bracket.Oh, from the label - GSM/GPRS/EDGE 850/900/1800/1900 UMTS/HSPA band 1/2/4/5Great phone for the cost.

Reviews.Title: Great option for Iphone
Reviews.Author: Almudena
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone, I used to own an Iphone and was pleasantly surprised. It is user friendly, not much need for the Instruction manual as it really is very easy to use. I love that most of the apps for Android are free, and the screen for this phone is larger than the Iphone, it takes great pics, and overall I have to say that I dropped it at least 4 times and it barely did any damage. It has options the Iphone doesn't like you can customize the ppl you receive calls from, I love this option! For the price and the fact that is unlocked it really makes it a no brainer. I have used Metro, Tmobile and even straight talk to the phone is versatile and you need no contracts. I love the phone and my bills are never higher than $45.

Reviews.Title: A very good choice.
Reviews.Author: Adriana
Reviews.Content: Great phone for price. Comparing with others that belong to the same range, it really is a good choice.I've been using it for a bit more than a week, and so far it works very well. A couples details:The camera isn't as good as I expected. Is not bad by any means, but it doesn't seem like the 8 mp add too much to the ones you can get with a 5 mp camera.Battery is alright. It gets you through the day and that's pretty much it.The model feels really comfortable to the hand, not too big and very light. I got it in white, and it look very elegant. The screen resolution is awesome.Performance is good, although it took me a bit to get used to it. I had Blackberry before, and I find those were a lot easier to customize. I mean, people with knowledge can do wonders with this phone, since it allows you many more liberties than Blackberry in customization, but if you don't know much about it it can be a bit difficult. But then, that's a critic to Android, not to the phone itself. It just takes a lot of time to arrange it *just* the way you want it (once it's done it's great, though).Speakers are good enough, although you have to make sure not to obstruct it with your finger or anything because then it sounds weird (in many other phones I've had that has never been an problem).There a many other little issues in the OS (again, that's mostly for Android, not the phone itself), like notifications or the running of apps, etc. Which I'm not 100% happy with, but those are things I *know* can be arranged however I want them (or most of them, anyway), except I haven't had the time to fiddle and play with it too much. So if you're new to Android, just know you need to give it time to completely get the hang of it..

Reviews.Title: verry good
Reviews.Author: Mary Carmen
Reviews.Content: i liked so much , is cute and its use is really easyi love my Phone...Thanks you so much

Reviews.Title: Solid phone
Reviews.Author: NM
Reviews.Content: Been 2 days thus far and so far so good. Supports high speed on lycamobile(t-mobile mvno) and per specs supports AT&T; but I have not tried it on ATT network. Solid voice quality - way better than Moto G and our recently returned S3 Mini. However the phone is a bit bulky and the metal power switch is plain ugly. Cover easily comes off which is a plus in my book but the overall protruded cover does not look too good. All in all, aesthetics are not the greatest but what matters to me most in a phone is solid - supports tmo and att bands, solid voice quality, adequate and expandable memory. Speaker volume is great too.6/6 Update: This is a solid phone and we are very happy with this. Voice quality beats S4(we own one) by a country mile.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Winston Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Congratulations i recommend this product for more people, i really satisfied with my Sony Xperia L C2014 Unlocked Phone, good job

Reviews.Content: Got this for my fifteen year old little brother and he carries this everywhere. He really loves this phone but would hate to admit it because he was a Samsung lover. This is really a great starter phone for him.

Reviews.Content: Hi this is a very nice phone. Try it and i am sure you wont regret it. Better than samsung for sure.

Reviews.Title: Love this Phone

Reviews.Content: I love this phone, it is better than the Xperia Ray plus its so light weight you barley feel it in your pocket. Sony, great work once again.

Reviews.Title: Get yours!!

Reviews.Title: great phone

Reviews.Title: Good!

Reviews.Content: Super fast delivery, in excellent condition, as is ordered and the phone works perfectly, very happy.Only Negative  thing that I thought would come with more accessories, but the rest all good

Reviews.Title: sony xperia L
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: Is a great cellphone for the price I buy it as a present for my girlfriend and she like it a lot

Reviews.Title: Bag Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Sony Marketed the Xperia L as a Camera and a Phone... That's why I bought it for my wife. The camera is not that great. My Samsung Note and the iPhone from my experience has better cameras.its other features are ok, but still a decent looking phone.

Reviews.Title: Looks good but deserves further research
Reviews.Author: Woody
Reviews.Content: I bought the phone as a gift for a friend, but then on searching for user reviews, I discovered that it appeared to have memory issues which require frequent factory reset. I have decided to return it, because I don't want to give a bad gift. So buy with caution, check online for updated user experiences before buying.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY NOT RECOMMEND
Reviews.Author: Maria E Fiorilli
Reviews.Content: recommendations NOT BUY THIS PHONEmany problems with shippingthe computer that sent a second time began to fail after 30 days warrantySony does not tell us if that phone discharged completely falls in sudden death does not turn anything the phone becomes unusable

Reviews.Title: Front camera is very dark
Reviews.Author: Manny
Reviews.Content: Just received this phone and observed that the front camera was very dark. Spoke to Sony tech support and the tech said that it is not the best camera indeed. It is VGA camera.The back camera was fine.
